intro: Chondrilla evae, commonly known as the Eave's chondrilla, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in a composite head. Chondrilla evae is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
